item.title: Arduino Quadcopter
item.description:
Arduino Quadcopter from scratch

Every engineer wishes to build a drone at least once in his life. I also dreamed about the same and took a step to make it totally from scratch without any readymade flight controllers. The motivation to build from scratch was to learn PID. I wanted to learn PID and apply it in the real-life.

pid

The basic goal of PID is to reach the desired state under given uncertainties. In case of Quadcopter there are uncertainties like wind, center of mass position, etc. You have tune PID parameters to obtain optimum results. From the following images, you can get an Intuitive idea of PID


for more brief and clear idea you can go through my PID tutorial

PID tutorial

2D model approximation for PID testing



Before applying PID on the quadcopter, I had to find an alternative model that will be safer to test so that, I can play around with it and see the response of different parameters of PID.
The 2D model approximation shown in the above image is best to do that. with the help of this model, I could learn more about PID and its parameter's response. The one more major learning was to learn how to apply filters like complementary filters, Kalman filters to reduce the noise in the gyroscope due to vibrations of the frame. you can watch the full video of the model that I made...

Watch Video

  • Components and Accessories

    • As there was no one to guide me on how to make it properly, I failed too many times. Things went wrong when I started testing. I harmed my self two times, broke the frame, the battery swelled and I had to replace it 3 times

  • Final Results

    • After months of efforts I could reach my goal!!!!!

    Watch hover video

item.title: Terrace Farming robot
item.description:
About the Competition

This Competition was held during the 8th Inter IIT Tech Meet. During this meet, different tech competitions are conducted between IITs. One of them was the "DIC's Terrace Farming Challenge for Hilly areas". The task was to design an autonomous robot that can climb steps of 40cm and perform basic farming tasks like Cutting, Plucking, etc.



Problem Statement

Our robot model

We had to come up with a design which will be compact and can perform given tasks including the climbing mechanism. after a week of brainstorming we came up with a design which includes a lead screw for the climbing mechanism and a rectangular shell around the bot which will perform the task of plowing and cutting. we also include a simple pipe with a funnel for seeding. This idea lead us to stood 2nd in indeation phase. Here are the pictures illustrating how our bot looks like:

climbing mechanism

The climbing mechanism includes series of motions of lead screw and driving wheels which will cause to bot lift up and move forward. Following image will illustrate the overall mechanism :



final assembly of bot and competition

After weeks of effort, we could complete the hardware assembly a day before the competition and that's why we didn't get time for testing. During the competition, due to electrical failures, we could not perform tasks. Though we didn't win the competition the overall experience of this project was life-changing for me, this Tech Meet changed my perspective of thinking in all aspects. Also, the train journey, debugging in the train, finding tools at late night in place which completely unknown to us was less than an adventure!

item.title: Flipkart Robotcs Challenge
item.description:
About Flipkart Grid 2.0 - Robotcs Challenge

During the pandemic period, Flipkart conducted an interesting competition for robotics enthusiasts under Flipkart Grid 2.0. There were three problem statements :

  • Intelligent Picking
  • Autonomous Indoor Drone
  • Autonomous Stair Climbing Robot.
We chose the Autonomous Indoor Drone Challenge in which we had to propose the solution of drone which will be able to carry 2kgs of load and able to navigate through a series of windows randomly placed in a room



View Problem statement

Our Solution

I designed the cad model consisting of depth camera (for navigation and localization), computation unit (Rpi4) and bucket (to carry payload). The design was based on the contrains due to size of window through which it has to pass.
Here are some images of the design:

After design was ready, our next step was to perform stability and structural analysis on frame of quadcopter in order to ensure that it will sustain in given conditions. At the same time team has to make a simulation of quad performing the tasks given problem statement.
I performed stress analysis and modal analysis on the frame using ANSYS simulation software using FEA model


Current Status of project

We cracked the simulation Challenge and now we are in national finale!!! only 3 teams got selected for finale. Our next target is to develope actual prototype

item.title: Team Aerov
item.description:
About Team Aerov

Team Aerov is a part of UMIC ( Umesh Mashruwal Innovation Cell ), IIT Bombay. This team focuses on Aerial robots related competition in worldwide. It has already participated in IARC Mission 7 and Barcelona Smart Drone challenge. Currently, it is focusing on IARC Mission 9. The detailed problem statement for IARC Mission 9 can be found here. Current major tasks are to travel 3 miles of distance and perform the task of replacing the communication module using the robotic arm on the drone

My contribution : Mechatronics Subsystem

My Current work is to design robotic arm with gripper for performing the tasks given in IARC Mission 9. I have made models for it and now working on optimizing its weight
